class.name: CapsuleShape4D
class.description: CapsuleShape4D describes a 4D capsule using a [member height] and [member radius]. The capsule is centered at the origin. The height spans vertically along the Y axis; if you want a capsule facing a different direction, you can rotate the [CollisionShape4D] node the capsule is attached to. When a 4D capsule is viewed directly from the top or bottom, it appears as a 3D sphere, with the center of the sphere closer to the viewer. This is similar to how a 3D capsule appears as a 2D circle when viewed from the top or bottom, with the center of the circle closer to the viewer.

members.member: The full height of the capsule in meters in the Y direction, including the hemispheres at both ends. This is the value that is stored internally.

The mid height of the capsule in meters in the Y direction, excluding the hemispheres at both ends. This is a wrapper around [member height] and [member radius] for situations where you want to use the mid height instead of the full height.
The radius of the capsule in meters in the XZW directions. This is the value that is stored internally.
